titleStmt.title: [Receipt] 1812 Sept. 29, United States to Timothy Meigs / Return J. Meigs : a machine readable transcription of an image
titleStmt.author: Meigs, Return Jonathan

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Special Collections Library, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Receipt] 1812 Sept. 29, United States to Timothy Meigs / Return J. Meigs
bibl.author: Meigs, Return Jonathan
bibl.note: This document is a receipt for payment of one hundred dollars and fifty cents to Timothy Meigs for delivering various goods to the Cherokee Indians. Return J. Meigs, agent for the War department, made the payment on behalf of the United States.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

table.head: The United States To Timothy Meigs Dr.

div1.p: The above given to Blackbird a Cherokee who had his son killed by a white man some time past____
The above given to a Cherokee who came with letters from Toluntuskee over the Mississippi
The above given the woman holder a Cherokee Chief on his way over the Mississippi
The above given a Cherokee who came with letters from the Cherokee Council.__
Received of Return J. Meigs one hundred & forty dollars & fifty-cents in full payment of the above account.

closer.add:
No. 26 No. 10
Timothy Meigs
receipt pay for sundries
delivered to Cherokees
Tobacco &c by order
―
$140.50
―
September 29th 1812
2 vouchers are No. 10
